meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characterized by syllepsis.
meanings.sent1: Her sylleptic storytelling kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent2: The sylleptic connection between the characters added depth to the plot.
meanings.sent3: The sylleptic twist in the tale made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His sylleptic humor was like a hidden gem in his writing.
meanings.sent5: The sylleptic details painted a vivid picture in the reader's mind.

meanings.definition: Involving a figure of speech in which one word applies to two others in different senses.
meanings.sent1: The sylleptic phrase left us pondering its dual meanings.
meanings.sent2: Her sylleptic use of language created a playful ambiguity.
meanings.sent3: The sylleptic wordplay made the conversation intriguing.
meanings.sent4: His sylleptic metaphor was both clever and thought-provoking.
meanings.sent5: The sylleptic expression added a touch of mystery to the poem.
